job_details.Vacaturetitel: Software Engineer for Training AI Data - Python, Dutch Language
job_details.Functieomschrijving:
You'll join an expert annotation team to create training data for the world's most advanced AI models. No previous AI experience is necessary. You'll get your foot in the door with one of the most prominent players in the AI/LLM space today. We seek software engineers with 3+ years of experience to train large AI language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. We currently have 200+ roles open!, * If you seem like a good fit, we'll send an async RLHF code review that will take 35 minutes and must be finished within 72 hours of us sending it.
     * You'll receive credentials to the RLHF platform. We'll then set up a group call to answer any further questions about onboarding with the company.
     * You'll perform a simulated production-level task (RLHF task) on the platform. This will be your final interview, which will ultimately determine your employment and leveling. Successful completion of this process provides you with an opportunity to work on projects as they become available.
job_details.full_text:
Software Engineer for Training AI Data - Python, Dutch Language

You'll join an expert annotation team to create training data for the world's most advanced AI models. No previous AI experience is necessary. You'll get your foot in the door with one of the most prominent players in the AI/LLM space today. We seek software engineers with 3+ years of experience to train large AI language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. We currently have 200+ roles open!, * If you seem like a good fit, we'll send an async RLHF code review that will take 35 minutes and must be finished within 72 hours of us sending it.
     * You'll receive credentials to the RLHF platform. We'll then set up a group call to answer any further questions about onboarding with the company.
     * You'll perform a simulated production-level task (RLHF task) on the platform. This will be your final interview, which will ultimately determine your employment and leveling. Successful completion of this process provides you with an opportunity to work on projects as they become available.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses heavily on data annotation and training data creation for AI models, rather than core AI model development, engineering, or deployment. While it mentions 'training large AI language models' and 'generative AI models', the core tasks described are data labeling and RLHF tasks, which are more aligned with data preparation and human feedback loops rather than the development or engineering of AI systems themselves. The emphasis on 'no previous AI experience necessary' and the nature of the tasks (annotation, RLHF code review) suggest a role that utilizes AI tools and processes rather than building or engineering them, fitting the 'Ambiguous' profile's criteria for roles primarily focused on the use of AI tools to enhance productivity or data preparation.

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'train large AI language models' and 'helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code' directly relates to the process of training or adapting AI models, even if the role is focused on providing the data for this training.
The description mentions 'engaging with these models as they learn to code', which implies interaction with the model's learning process, a component of model training.
job_tasks.phrase: engaging with these models as they learn to code

job_tasks.justification: The mention of 'async RLHF code review' and 'simulated production-level task (RLHF task)' indicates involvement in Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback, a method used to fine-tune and improve AI models.
The mention of 'simulated production-level task (RLHF task)' indicates involvement in Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback, a method used to fine-tune and improve AI models.

The role is described as 'Software Engineer for Training AI Data', and the tasks involve code reviews and potentially interacting with models that write code, suggesting some level of software engineering skills are applied, albeit in a specialized context.

soft_skills.phrase: No previous AI experience is necessary
get your foot in the door
take 35 minutes and must be finished within 72 hours
